ygData.msgSnippet: By the tone of your vocal circuits I take it this Icedemons not on the best of terms with you? Lunarpine knows how to ask the question just right as not to

"By the tone of your vocal circuits I take it this Icedemons not on 
the best of terms with you?" Lunarpine knows how to ask the question 
just right as not to come across as judgeing Prowls choice. He knows 
that Prowl could be making a big mistake letting a stranger near the 
new base this soon. Lunarpine just hoped it wouldn't be the last 
command decision Prowl made.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Prowl/Striker/Ramulus/Striker::
> 
> Prowl frowns, recieving Icedemon's message. Was it a good idea to 
let those 
> two in? They had, after all, betrayed the last factions they have 
been in. 
> But on the other hand, they had always tried to help the Maximals 
out.
> 
> "Yeah," he replies over his comm-link to Icedemon, "I'll send you 
the 
> coordinates of the new base," he finishes the message, sending the 
> coordanates, and turns back to Lunarpine.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Striker drops off what he packed from his old quarters. He looks 
around. His 
> new quarters were quite nice, and (if Sona ever RP's), Sona had 
lots of space 
> too. He exits the room, heading for Kluster.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Ramulus runs up beside Primal, transforming.
> 
> "Hello. You're a maximal?"
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Kluster looks sadly over at Chordate.
> 
> "10, including us two," he says, glancing at the scanners, "But the 
other 
> Maximals on the planet have made contact. They're moving in."
> 
> He points to one of the security screens, showing Striker walking 
down a 
> hallway leading to the bridge.
